assessments.status_rationale: Today’s bullets do not mention Ofcom, UK online safety regulation, consultations/calls for evidence, or any explicit discussion of exceptional access/backdoors/technical capability notices for end-to-end encrypted messaging platforms.

No item indicates FinCEN issued an advisory/alert/guidance about cryptocurrency ATMs or ATM-related fraud/scams. The crypto-related bullet is about lawmakers preparing to try again on a major crypto bill, not FinCEN guidance.

There is no evidence in today’s bullets of a House Financial Services or Senate Banking Committee hearing explicitly focused on cryptocurrency ATMs and fraud/scams (either in title or witness testimony).
No bullet references FDA acceptance/filing of an NDA for an oral GLP-1 (or GLP-1/GIP) weight-management drug or a publicly stated PDUFA/target action date.
Nothing in today’s bullets references TrendForce/DRAMeXchange reporting HBM contract-price changes, nor any Q2 vs Q1 2026 comparison.
No bullet indicates Micron, Samsung, or SK hynix raised FY2026/2026 capex guidance by $2B+ with explicit citation to HBM/AI-memory capacity expansion.

While there are bullets about Iran-related tensions (e.g., reports that Trump is weighing options against Iran), none report a U.S. State Department ordered departure (or directed departure of non-emergency personnel) from a Middle East diplomatic post citing Iran-related heightened tensions.

The Iran-related coverage concerns protests and leadership response; it does not clearly report a nationwide Iranian fuel-price increase or rationing/quota policy change confirmed by officials or Reuters/AP/AFP.

Although one bullet discusses geopolitical interest in Greenland/the Arctic, there is no mention of the European Commission/EIB/EIF announcing €200M+ in financing/guarantees/grants for a Greenland-based critical-minerals project.
